description:
'''Electro-industrial''' is a [[subgenre]] of [[post-industrial music]] that emerged in the early 1980s. It was originally pioneered by acts such as [[Front 242]], [[Cabaret Voltaire (band)|Cabaret Voltaire]], [[Front Line Assembly]], [[Klinik]], [[Numb (band)|Numb]], as well as groups from Canada and the [[Benelux]].   

Other influential acts included Canadian band [[Skinny Puppy]], who signed to label [[Nettwerk Music Group|Nettwerk]], which served as a central hub that helped proliferate the style. By the early 1990s, electro-industrial spawned the [[dark electro]] genre, and later the [[aggrotech]] offshoot. The fan base for the style is linked to the [[rivethead]] subculture.
